description:
This update brings major improvements to the launcher, authentication, store, and website.

Additions:
- Changed welcome screen and authentication to use Discord
- Upgraded store system with added coins
- Launcher interface now resembles 93% of the PC launcher
- Allows saving and opening multiple versions
- Added mod support in the launcher to install features not available in vanilla Minecraft
- Updated splash screen to match the original launcher with improved animation

Changes:
- Enhanced website system
- Improved overall launcher performance and UI

A new update has been released for LF Launcher introducing major improvements and new language support.
This update also enhances the offline launcher experience and expands compatibility with multiple Minecraft clients.

Additions:
- Added launcher terms of service
- Removed login, replaced with full offline mode
- Added support for launching 3 versions (Atlas Client and Patch)
- Added pre-loading system before entering Minecraft
- Added 2 new languages: Chinese and Arabic
- Added a welcome notification

Changes:
- Launcher UI now resembles the Java Edition by 89%

This update focuses on connectivity improvements, store expansion, and more flexible installation management.

Additions:
- Added network connection check screen
- Added skin and mod stores
- Added in-launcher downloading and rating system for skins and mods

Changes:
- Redesigned settings and download interfaces
- Added ability to rename and delete installed Minecraft versions directly

This major update brings new visuals, version management, and broader language support.

Additions:
- New splash screen
- Added quick version switch popup
- Added APK downloader for all Minecraft PE versions
- Added feature menu as a popup window
- Added account registration and login system

Changes:
- Optimized UI and version management system
- Added version manager for installing or removing versions
- Added 3 new languages: Vietnamese, Spanish, Russian

LF Launcher now introduces its new identity and branding updates.

Additions:
- Changed splash screen to “Lastfom Studio”
- Added Release Notes and “About” screen with launcher details
- Added official launcher website

Changes:
- Renamed to LF Launcher (formerly “Minecraft Launcher”)
- Updated mouse cursor design

A large update bringing mobile support and new in-launcher experiences.

Additions:
- Added mobile layout
- Added update notifications
- Added End Poem from Minecraft
- Added new coordinates and puppet feature for launcher Minecraft

Changes:
- Switch between PC and Mobile layouts
- Updated splash screen and RAM management
- Added multi-version download and logcat support

UI redesign and feature expansion toward Java Edition–style experience.

Additions:
- New Windows 10–style interface, now 80% similar to Java Edition
- Added in-launcher store
- Added website for skin customization

Changes:
- Updated to version 0.15.4
- Added ability to change player name inside the launcher

Major launcher redesign for Java Edition–style interface and customization support.

Additions:
- New launcher design (67% similar to Java Edition)
- Added skin download via WebView
- Added language switching
- Added lightweight shaders for low-end devices

Changes:
- Added support for opening original Minecraft installation on device

UI redesign inspired by Minecraft Java Edition and PS3-style interface.

Additions:
- Redesigned interface similar to Minecraft Java Edition launcher
- Added in-game music menu (PS3-style)
- Added server list to join directly from launcher

Changes:
- New app icon

Initial launcher release introducing Windows 10–style interface and Java-inspired splash screen.

Additions:
- Added splash screen inspired by Minecraft Java Edition
- Added Windows 10–style UI

Changes:
- Improved visual performance by removing particles in version 0.14.0
